meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Are Foxconn Internships Now Better Than American Internships?

div.div: While the FLA’s audit of Foxconn’s internship practices revealed far more serious issues than one might find in your typical fashion or marketing internship in Midtown, its new policies are perhaps ones that many unpaid and overworked interns in the U.S. would like to see replicated here.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PFtuOM&via=Digg&text=Are Foxconn Internships Now Better Than American Internships?

div.a: SEAL Pens Bin Laden Raid Tell-All

div.div: A detailed first-person account of the raid that killed Osama bin Laden, written under a pseudonym by a member of the Navy SEALs who participated in the mission and was present at bin Laden’s death, will be released next month.

li.div: Can't wait to see what sort of disguise the anonymous Navy Seal adopts for his TV author interviews. mediadecoder.blogs.nytimes.com...

div.a: Are Antibiotics Fueling The Obesity Epidemic?

div.div: Expanding waistlines may be caused by more than bad diets and sedentary habits. Antibiotics could be disrupting our gut bacteria, helping people pack on fat like farm animals.
L.A.'s own Gallery1988 Melrose teamed up with Sony to launch a four-month "Breaking Gifs" marketing campaign, and the culmination of the TV-centric art project is now on display at the gallery.

div.a: Hundreds Of DHS Employees Arrested Last Year

div.div: Border Patrol agents smuggling weed and coke. Immigration agents forging documents and robbing drug dealers. TSA employees caught with child porn. Those are just a few of the crimes perpetrated by Department of Homeland Security employees in just the past year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SocuPQ&via=Digg&text=Hundreds Of DHS Employees Arrested Last Year

div.div: Why is tickling only an activity reserved for two or more people? And why exactly did we evolve to be ticklish in the first place?
MORE LIKE HIGGS BORE-SON, RIGHT? RIGHT?

div.a: Higgs Boson Faces The Perils Of Predictability

div.div: Fulfilling expectations is normally a good thing. But the fact that the newly discovered Higgs boson is behaving exactly as expected is cutting its chances of lighting a path to new physics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NkuV15&via=Digg&text=Higgs Boson Faces The Perils Of Predictability

div.a: New Apple Patent Could Kill Commercial Radio

div.div: Apple have posted a fascinating new patent which allows for "seamlessly switching media playback between a media broadcast, such as a radio broadcast, and media from a local media library."

li.div: Apple's new patent could be used to strip out live radio ads by playing offline content instead mediauk.com/article/34058/...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OO8Bgn&via=Digg&text=New Apple Patent Could Kill Commercial Radio

div.a: Protected Sea Lions Gorge On Threatened Salmon

div.div: What do you do when a charismatic marine mammal is wreaking havoc by gorging on a threatened species that humans also find delicious?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/STTKDG&via=Digg&text=Protected Sea Lions Gorge On Threatened Salmon

div.a: FTC Clears Facebook's Acquisition Of Instagram

div.div: The FTC has closed its investigation of Facebook's acquisition of Instagram without taking any action. The deal may now proceed as proposed.

div.a: Neil DeGrasse Tyson On Blowing Up Asteroids

div.div: The world's coolest astrophysicist, Neil DeGrasse Tyson, spoke to Vice about what it would take to actually stop an asteroid from colliding with Earth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QTMt56&via=Digg&text=Neil DeGrasse Tyson On Blowing Up Asteroids

div.div: An iPhone 4 prototype with a very unusual logo has landed on eBay.

li.div: If anyone can find one real world example of my usage you will be awarded one Internet.

div.a: Nike Retailers Are Bracing For Sneaker Riots

div.div: Nike's new $315 shoe, the Lebron X Nike Plus, may not come out until this fall but the shoemaker is already issuing safety directives to retailers to prevent riots.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PbzWe7&via=Digg&text=Nike Retailers Are Bracing For Sneaker Riots

div.a: Robbers Caught After Sending Thank-You To White Mask Makers

div.div: The New York City Police Department has collared two brazen burglars who robbed a cash-checking store in Queens disguised as cops, thanks to their polite letter of appreciation to their unwitting mask maker.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OZXois&via=Digg&text=Robbers Caught After Sending Thank-You To White Mask Makers

div.div: This is an amazing portrait drawn by 29-year-old Portugal-based attorney Samuel Silva. Silva’s medium of choice is standard Bic ballpoint pens on paper and this particular portrait uses six different colors plus black, taking some 30 hours to complete.
